db:abstract.db:para: A sample WebSocket client that sends a message and displays the message that it receives back.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: The EchoClient example implements a WebSocket client that sends a message to a WebSocket server and dumps the answer that it gets back. This example should ideally be used with the EchoServer example.

db:section.db:title: Code
db:section.db:para: We start by connecting to the `connected()` signal.
After the connection, we open the socket to the given url.
When the client is connected successfully, we connect to the `onTextMessageReceived()` signal, and send out "Hello, world!". If connected with the EchoServer, we will receive the same message back.
Whenever a message is received, we write it out.
